intro: Ischaemum inerme, commonly known as field barnyard grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils, such as agricultural fields and roadsides. The plant has slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves with a bluish-green hue. Its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, two-ranked spikelets, which are usually pale green to brown in color. Ischaemum inerme is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to compete with crops.
